alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 7:51PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rutland and southwestern Windsor Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 750 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Granville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chester, Pawlet, Mount Holly, Ludlow, Mount Tabor, Andover, Weston, Tinmouth, Shrewsbury, Ludlow Village, Middletown Springs, Wallingford, Mt. Holly, Mt. Tabor, Danby, Lake St. Catherine, Rutland - Southern Vermont Airport, Plymouth, Clarendon, and Wells. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
